{{Infobox software |name = Sobi2 |logo = Sobi2logo.png |developer = Sigrid Suski and Radek Suski |released = {{release date|2006|09|12}} |latest release version = 2.9.4.2 stable |latest release date = {{release date|2012|07|18}} |discontinued = yes |programming language = [[PHP]] |operating system = [[Cross-platform]] |platform = [[Joomla]]! [[Content management system|CMS]] up to version 1.5 |genre = [[Web directory|Directory]] |license = [[GNU General Public License]] v2 |website = {{url|https://www.sigsiu.net/}} }} '''Sobi2''' (formerly written as '''SOBI2''') is the abbreviation of '''Sigsiu Online Business Index 2'''. Sobi2 is a free of charge [[open-source software|open-source]] [[web directory]] component and [[content construction kit]] (CCK) for the [[Joomla]]! [[content management system]] (CMS). Sobi2 is written in the programming language [[PHP]], also makes use of [[Javascript]] and requires the [[MySQL]] database environment for storage. It is best suited for low to medium-level traffic web-sites. Sobi2's development has been discontinued in 2011, when its successor, [[SobiPro]] comes out.
Sobi2 was listed in the Joomla! Extensions Directory <ref>{{cite web |title=Joomla Extensions Directory |url=http://extensions.joomla.org/ }}</ref> until all extensions for Joomla! 1.5 were removed in 2013.<ref>{{cite web |date=2013-02-06 |title=JED 1.5 Version Support Ends |url=https://community.joomla.org/blogs/leadership/1716-jed-15-version-support-ends.html }}</ref> The listing still can be found in the Web Archive.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sobi2 in Joomla! Extensions Directory (Web archive)|url=http://archive.extensions.joomla.org/extensions/directory-a-documentation/directory/1113|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130827055957/http://archive.extensions.joomla.org/extensions/directory-a-documentation/directory/1113|archivedate=2013-08-27|df=}}</ref>
As a component for [[Joomla!]] (up to version 1.5), Sobi2 made it possible to run and manage a directory in a Joomla! [[website]]. Sobi2 has features that made it stand out from other directory components at that time. It could be used as a web directory or as a directory to physical locations, like golf courses. It has a built-in integration with [[Google Maps]] (API key from [[Google]] is required).
Sobi2 was built with a modular concept, where additional functionality was added via plug-ins. The Joomla extensions directory listed over 80 plug-ins for Sobi2 at that time.
==Directory Component for Joomla== Sobi2 is an open source directory component for [[Joomla]]! (up to version 1.5), an [[open-source software|open-source]] [[content management system]]. Using Sobi2 a [[Joomla]] user can have a directory of contacts, members, distributors, manufacturers, locations, products, or whatever very quickly with little or no "coding" - most or all of the set-up may be done using only the configuration interface. Add data, to produce a working directory on the Joomla web site.
==History== In 2006 [[Sigsiu.NET]] developed a [[Content Construction Kit]] for Joomla. Designed as a business directory (online business index), Sobi2 could be used for every kind of directory.
Sobi2 has been designed as the follower of the SOBI component but it is not based on SOBI. It has been built up new from the bottom because the table structure of SOBI was not suited for the new features implemented in Sobi2. Sobi2 is built up almost [[object oriented]]. It runs under [[PHP]]4 and [[MySQL]]4.<ref>{{cite web |date=2009-09-01 |title=Component description on the official homepage |url=https://www.sigsiu.net/sobi2-component }}</ref>
Sobi2's development has been discontinued in 2011, when its successor, [[SobiPro]] came out.<ref>{{cite web |title=Difference between Sobi versions |url=https://www.sigsiu.net/center/sobipro-component/209-difference-between-sobi-versions }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=2011-02-28 |title=SobiPro RC1 ready to download |url=https://www.sigsiu.net/news/383-sobipro-rc1-ready-to-download }}</ref>
==Description== Sobi2 is an add-on (component) to [[Joomla]]! (up to version 1.5) that makes it possible to run and manage a directory in your [[Joomla]]! website.
To add listings to the directory, an input form needs to be filled out.
While setting up the directory, the input form is built by the site developer using the integrated fields manager to add the various field types (text input fields, text areas (w/o [[WYSIWYG]] editor), check boxes, check box groups, select lists (drop down), simple text fields or calendar fields) to the form. The layout of the form can be changed by the usage of the built-in [[Template engine (web)|template]] engine.
During installation, Sobi2 creates input fields for a [[business directory]]. They can be changed, deleted or extended by additional fields.
There is an option to make features of the listings paid for or free. E.g. listings could be free but charge for links to the websites. This is decided when setting up and managing the component. <ref>{{cite web |date=2007-12-28 |title=Creating portal with Joomla and Sobi2 in mycmsblog.com |url=http://cmacws.wordpress.com/2014/05/22/community-portal-iqaluitonline-com/ }}</ref>
The administrator of the directory site is able to create, edit or delete listings within the Sobi2 administration panel.
Listings within a Sobi2 directory are assigned to one or more categories. A category manager allows to create, edit and delete categories within the directory with an unlimited nesting depth.
As a complex [[Joomla]]! component, Sobi2 has different views to present its data. In an overview all directory listings are shown with their smaller description, linked to a detailed description. Other views are available (e.g. alpha, search, user listings).
Especially for directories with paid listings, but also to keep the directory up to date, Sobi2 has the possibility to associate the listings with an expiration date. Once expired, listings can be renewed.
Sobi2 can be used "out of the box" or adapted individually to the site. It provides a [[Style sheet (web development)|style sheet]] file ([[CSS]]) which can be edited in the administration panel, using an editor with syntax highlighting.
For advanced adaptations there are separate templates available for the different views.
Sobi2 sends out [[email]]s on different events (add, edit, renew, approval). Sending out an [[email]] can be set up separately for each event. The content of the emails can be defined using placeholders, separately for each event.
Sobi2 has integrated diagnosis systems to log occurring problems. A template parser is helpful in finding syntactical errors while developing own templates. A built-in system check detects if a server does not meet the requirements for Sobi2. A version checker checks for newer versions.
'''Additional Features''' * Dynamical page title generation ([[Search Engine Optimization|SEO]]). * Listing dependent meta data ([[Index term|keywords]] and description). * Configurable search function with built-in category search. * [[RSS]] feeds generation of the whole directory, each category view, newest, most popular or random listings. * Built-in multi state [[cache (computing)|cache]] system for fast retrieving of data. * Built-in [[:wikt:template|template]] system for creating templates for the main views. * Integration of [[Paypal]] for paid listings. * Integration of [[Google Maps]] directly in the detailed view. * Modules, [[Joomla]]! and Sobi2 plug-ins are available to extend the possibilities of Sobi2.
==Plug-in interface== To enhance the functionality of Sobi2, there were more than 80 different plug-ins available and listed in the Joomla! Extensions Directory at that time. These listings still can be found in the Web Archive.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sobi2 plug-ins in Joomla! Extensions Directory (Web archive)|url=http://archive.extensions.joomla.org/extensions/extension-specific/sobi2-extensions|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130825135627/http://archive.extensions.joomla.org/extensions/extension-specific/sobi2-extensions|archivedate=2013-08-25|df=}}</ref>
'''Sobi2 plug-ins (incomplete list)''' * [http://www.myjoom.com/products/sobi2-plugins Sobi2 plugins package] * [https://www.acyba.com/acymailing/158-acymailing-plugin-sobi2.html Acymailing Plugin: Sobi2] * [http://www.artio.net/e-shop/joomla-extensions/joomsef/joomsef-3-extensions/sobi2-joomsef-3-extension SOBI2 JoomSEF 3 Extension] * [http://www.joomlathat.com/content-statistics/extensions/statistics-for-sobi2 Graphic statistics, analytics and reports for Sobi2] * [http://www.joomlatune.com/jcomments-sobi2.html Integration of JComments to SOBI2 business catalogue]
==Languages== Originally equipped with English languages files, Sobi2 has been translated into 34 languages (Arabic, Basque, Brazilian Portuguese, Bulgarian, Catalan, Chinese (simplified), Chinese (traditional), Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Farsi, Finnish, French, Galician, German, Greek, Hebrew, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Serbian, Slovenian, Spanish, Swedish, Thai, Turkish, and Vietnamese). Additional languages are installable via Sobi2 language manager.
==Further reading== * ''Joomla Extensions: Sobi2, Uddeim, Tinymce, Joomlalms, Virtuemart, Jafilia, Hwdvideoshare, Ckeditor, Civicrm, Tinywebgallery, Magebridge'', Books LLC, {{ISBN|978-1155211831}} * Suhreed Sarkar, ''Joomla! 1.5 Top Extensions Cookbook'', Packt Publishing Limited (2010), [https://www.packtpub.com/web-development/joomla-15-top-extensions-cookbook ASIN B00LY1BSPU] *{{cite book | last1 = Boateng | first1 = Kwasi | last2 = Boateng | first2 = Beatrice A. | year = 2010 | title = Joomla! Social Networking with JomSocial | publisher = Packt Publishing Ltd | isbn = 9781847199577}}
==See also==
{{Portal|Free software}} * [[Joomla]] * [[Mambo (CMS)]] * [[MiaCMS]] * [[VirtueMart]] * [[UddeIM]] * [[CKEditor]] * [[CiviCRM]] * [[web directory]] * [[List of web directories]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [https://www.sigsiu.net/ Official homepage] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20130827055957/http://archive.extensions.joomla.org/extensions/directory-a-documentation/directory/1113 Sobi2 in Joomla! Extensions Directory (Web archive)] * [https://www.sigsiu.net/center/sobipro-component/209-difference-between-sobi-versions Difference between Sobi versions] * [http://www.phpbuilder.com/columns/joomla-cck/Vojislav_Janjic07192011.php3 Joomla CCK Comparison: Flexicontent vs. K2, jSeblod and Sobi2] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m9An8iV6etY Using Sobi2 Directory] * [https://www.ostraining.com/blog/joomla/setting-up-a-joomla-business-directory-or-yellow-pages/ Setting up a Joomla Business Directory or Yellow Pages] * [http://www.lgr.ca/blog/2008/01/joomla-directory-component-sobi-2.html Joomla Directory Component Sobi2 in LGR Webmaster Blog] * [https://www.packtpub.com/books/content/creating-content-social-networking-using-joomla Creating Content in Social Networking using Joomla!]
'''Non-English articles''' * [https://www.alexander-fischer-online.net/joomla-erweiterungen/sobi2-die-branchenbuchloesung.html Sobi2 die Branchenbuchlösung] * [https://www.dmsolutions.de/joomla-erweiterungen/sobi2.html Sobi2] * [https://www.toolstage.de/sonstige-tools/erweiterungen-fuer-die-joomla-komponente-sobi2 Erweiterungen für die Joomla-Komponente SOBI2] * [http://www.html.it/articoli/joomla-creare-una-directory-con-sobi2-1/ Joomla, creare una directory con SOBI2] * [https://ayudajoomla.com/joomla/tutoriales/367-crear-un-directorio-de-contenidos-con-sobi2.html Tutorial de Sobi2 - Creación de un directorio de contenidos] * [http://www.joomla.pl/zasoby/na-twoja-witryne/sobi-2-doskonalszy SOBI 2 doskonalszy] * [http://www.joomla.it/articoli-della-community/3971-aggiungere-un-nuovo-tipo-di-campo-in-sobi2.html Aggiungere un nuovo tipo di campo in SOBI2] * [https://www.joomlagate.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=183:radek-suski-and-sigrid-sobi2-developed-sigsiu-online-business-index-2&catid=29:joomla-people&Itemid=19 Radek Suski 和 Sigrid Suski：夫妻开店共推 SOBI2]

revision.text:
{{italic title}} [[Image:Systemic Census of Australian Plants.PNG|right|thumb|The title page of the census]] The '''''Systematic census of Australian plants, with chronologic, literary and geographic annotations''''', more commonly known as the '''''Systematic Census of Australian Plants''''', also known by its standard botanic abbreviation '''''Syst. Census Austral. Pl.''''',{{cite web | title = Systematic census of Australian plants … | work = [[IPNI]] | url = http://www.ipni.org/ipni/idPublicationSearch.do?id=5805-2 | accessdate = 2007-03-28}} is a survey of the [[vascular plant|vascular]] [[flora of Australia]] prepared by Government [[botanist]] for the state of [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] [[Ferdinand von Mueller]] and published in 1882. Von Mueller describes the development of the census in the preface of the volume as an extension of the seven volumes of the ''[[Flora Australiensis]]'' written by [[George Bentham]]. A new flora was necessary since as more areas of Australia were explored and settled, the flora of the [[Australia (continent)|island-continent]] became better collected and described. The first census increased the number of described species from the 8125 in ''Flora Australiensis'' to 8646. The book records all the known species indigenous to Australia and [[Norfolk Island]]; with records of species distribution. Von Mueller noted that by 1882 it had become difficult to distinguish some introduced species from native ones:
The lines of demarkation between truly indigenous and more recently immigrated plants can no longer in all cases be drawn with precision; but whereas ''[[Alchemilla vulgaris]]'' and ''[[Veronica serpyllifolia]]'' were found along with several European Carices in untrodden parts of the [[Australian Alps]] during the author's earliest explorations, ''[[Alchemilla arvensis]]'' and ''[[Veronica peregrina]]'' were at first only noticed near settlements. The occurrence of ''[[Arabis glabra]]'', ''[[Geum urbanum]]'', ''[[Agiimonia eupatoria]]'', ''[[Eupatorium cannabinum]]'', ''[[Cavpesium cernuum]]'' and some others may therefore readily be disputed as indigenous, and some questions concerning the nativity of various of our plants will probably remain for ever involved in doubts.{{cite book | author = Mueller, F. | year = 1882 | title = Systematic census of Australian plants | publisher = Victorian Government | authorlink = Ferdinand von Mueller}}
In 1889 an updated edition of the census was published, the ''Second Systematic Census'' increased the number of described species to 8839.Orchard, A. E. 1999. Introduction. In A. E. Orchard, ed. ''Flora of Australia - Volume 1'', 2nd edition pp 1-9. Australian Biological Resources Study {{ISBN|0-643-05965-2}} Von Mueller dedicated both works to [[Joseph Dalton Hooker]] and [[A. P. de Candolle]]. The work is of historic significance as the first Australian flora written in Australia. Following its publication, research and writing on the flora of Australia has largely been carried out in Australia. ==See also== *[[Australian Bird Count]] (ABC) *''[[Flora of Australia (series)]]'' (59-volume series) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[https://archive.org/details/systematiccensus01mueluoft Full text of the Systematic Census of Australian Plants from the Internet Archive] [[Category:19th-century books]] [[Category:Biological censuses]] [[Category:Books about Australian natural history]] [[Category:Florae (publication)]] [[Category:Botany in Australia]]

{{Infobox book | name = The Well-Spoken Thesaurus | title_orig = | translator = | image = The Well-Spoken Thesaurus Cover Art.jpg | caption = | author = Tom Heehler | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = United States | language = English | series = | subject = [[Style guide]] | genre = | publisher = [[Sourcebooks]] | pub_date = 2011 | english_pub_date = | media_type = Paperback book | pages = 400 | isbn = 1-4022-4305-7 | dewey = 413.12 | congress= PE1591 .H397 2011 | preceded_by = | followed_by = }}
'''''The Well-Spoken Thesaurus''''' by Tom Heehler ([[Sourcebooks]] 2011), is an American [[style guide]] and speaking aid. The ''[[Chicago Tribune]]'' calls ''The Well-Spoken Thesaurus'' "a celebration of the spoken word".<ref>Chicago Tribune http://www.chicagotribune.com/features/tribu/ct-tribu-words-work-wellspoken-20110907,0,1324710.story</ref> The book has also been reviewed in the ''[[Winnipeg Free Press]]'',<ref name=winnipeg>{{cite news|url=http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/arts-and-life/life/speech-therapy-127816198.html|title=Speech therapy|last=Vesely|first=Carolyn|date=1 August 2011|work=[[Winnipeg Free Press]]|accessdate=12 September 2011}}</ref> and by bloggers at the ''[[Fayetteville Observer]]'',<ref>Fayetteville Observer http://blogs.fayobserver.com/rundus/August-2011/Spoken-English-Bespoken-by-A-Young-Harvard-Univers</ref> and the ''[[Seattle Post-Intelligencer]]''.<ref>Seattle Post-Intelligencer http://blog.seattlepi.com/thewritersblock/2011/05/20/book-review-the-well-spoken-thesaurus/</ref>
== Content ==
The book consists of two sections—a 50-page style guide entitled "Rhetorical Form and Design", and a 350-page [[thesaurus]] section. However, what distinguishes this thesaurus from all conventional thesauri is the inclusion of what the author calls rhetorically related words, or ''powernyms''—as opposed to merely synonymous words. According to Heehler, these powernyms allow users to more readily transform rough drafts into more eloquent improvements.
In "Rhetorical Form and Design," Heehler serves up 17 lessons from such writers and speakers as [[T.S. Eliot]], [[Margaret Atwood]], [[John Steinbeck]], [[Ernest Hemingway]], [[Barack Obama]], [[Martin Luther King Jr.]], and [[Cintra Wilson]]. Rhetorical and literary techniques covered include the [[objective correlative]], rhetorical objectification, [[verb displacement]], rhetorical agency, rhetorical tension, poetic articles, preposition exchange, creative number, and intuitive description.
== Origins ==
According to Heehler, the idea for ''The Well-Spoken Thesaurus'' came to him while attending the [[Harvard Extension School]], where he came to realize just how poorly spoken he truly was. And because there were no books available with which to solve his problem, he began to create a database of eloquent words. Whenever he would chance upon a well-spoken word or phrase at Harvard, he would pair that with what ''he'' would have said. After three years of doing this, of "collecting words like butterflies," he decided that his "butterfly collection" could be of use to others.<ref name=winnipeg/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
== External links == *[http://thewordsilearnedatharvard.blogspot.com/ The Well-Spoken Thesaurus Website]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Well-Spoken Thesaurus}} [[Category:2011 books]] [[Category:English language]] [[Category:Thesauri]] [[Category:Style guides for American English]] [[Category:Sourcebooks books]]

revision.text:
[[File:Thorne-room-miniatures-1760-new-hampshire-dining-room-table.jpg|thumb|Table in the 1760 New Hampshire dining room, Thorne miniature rooms at the [[Art Institute of Chicago]]]]
The '''Thorne miniature rooms''' are a set of approximately 100 [[Room box|miniature models of rooms]] created between 1932 and 1940 under the direction of [[Narcissa Niblack Thorne]]. Ninety-nine of the rooms are believed still to be in existence; the majority (68) are on display at the [[Art Institute of Chicago]], while 20 are at the [[Phoenix Art Museum]], nine at the [[Knoxville Museum of Art]], and one each at [[The Children's Museum of Indianapolis]] and the [[Kaye Miniature Museum]] in [[Los Angeles]]. The Art Institute's rooms document European and American interiors from the late 13th century to the 1930s and the 17th century to the 1930s, respectively. Constructed on a [[1:12 scale]], the rooms are largely made of the same materials as full-sized rooms, and some even include original works of art.
== Background == The model rooms were the brainchild of [[Narcissa Niblack Thorne]],<ref name="PAM" /><ref name="AIC" /> who was born in 1882 in [[Vincennes, Indiana]].<ref name="Siebert" /><ref name="Kogan" /> During her childhood, her uncle [[Albert Parker Niblack]], a [[United States Navy]] vice admiral, sent her many antique [[dollhouse]] miniatures from around the world.<ref name="Siebert" /> The idea for the model rooms also developed from Thorne's collection of miniature furniture and household accessories, which she began assembling around 1900, and her desire to house and display these items.<ref name="PAM" /> A further inspiration may have been a miniature [[shadow box]] that she encountered at a [[bazaar]] in [[Istanbul]] during the 1920s.<ref name="Siebert" />
When she was 19, Thorne married [[Montgomery Ward]] department store heir [[James Ward Thorne]], whose fortune would help finance her hobby.<ref name="Siebert" /><ref name="Kogan">{{Cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/ct-xpm-2012-12-03-chi-kogan-sidewalks-thorne-rooms-20121130-story.html|title=Thorne Rooms full of small wonders|last=Kogan|first=Rick|date=December 3, 2012|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|access-date=September 23, 2018}}</ref> They lived together in [[Lake Forest, Illinois]].<ref name="Kogan" /> By 1930, Thorne was researching period architecture, interior design, and decorative arts to create sketches and blueprints for miniature rooms to house her dollhouse miniatures and other miniature furniture.<ref name="Siebert" />
== Description == [[File:12-1257-miniatures-chandelier-chicago-museum-art.jpg|thumb|150px|Chandelier detail, Thorne miniature rooms at the Art Institute of Chicago]]
During the [[Great Depression]], Thorne had access to some of the top architects, interior designers, and craftsmen in the United States, who between 1932 and 1940 created approximately 100 "period rooms" under her direction.<ref name="PAM" /><ref name="AIC" /><ref name="Siebert">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/20/magazine/letter-of-recommendationthe-thorne-miniature-rooms.html|title=Letter of Recommendation: The Thorne Miniature Rooms|last=Siebert|first=Charles|date=September 17, 2015|work=[[The New York Times Magazine]]|access-date=September 23, 2018|author-link=Charles Siebert}}</ref> In total, 99 of the rooms are believed still to be in existence.<ref name="PAM" /><ref name="LaFree" /> The original 30 were placed on display at the 1933 [[Century of Progress|Century of Progress Exposition]] in [[Chicago]],<ref name="PAM" /><ref name="Kogan" /> and in 1940 they were the subject of a [[Life (magazine)|''LIFE'' magazine]] article.<ref name="PAM" /> Twenty of these original rooms were donated to the [[Phoenix Art Museum]], where they remain on display.<ref name="PAM" />
The majority of the rooms, 68 in all, are on display at the [[Art Institute of Chicago]], where they document European and American interiors from the late 13th century to the 1930s and the 17th century to the 1930s, respectively.<ref name="PAM">{{Cite web|url=http://www.phxart.org/collection/thornerooms|title=Thorne Miniature Rooms|publisher=[[Phoenix Art Museum]]|access-date=September 23, 2018}}</ref><ref name="AIC">{{Cite web|url=http://www.artic.edu/aic/collections/thorne|title=Thorne Miniature Rooms|publisher=[[Art Institute of Chicago]]|access-date=September 23, 2018}}</ref><ref name="Zivanovic" /> The Art Institute's rooms were created by Thorne and her craftsmen between 1932 and 1940 at her studio on [[Oak Street (Chicago)|Oak Street]] on the city's [[Near North Side, Chicago|Near North Side]];<ref name="Kogan" /><ref name="LaFree" /> the 31 European rooms were finished by 1937, while the 37 American rooms were completed by 1940.<ref name="Kogan" /> The rooms were gifted to the museum in 1941, and put on permanent display in 1954.<ref name="Kogan" /><ref name="LaFree">{{Cite news|url=https://chicago.curbed.com/2016/9/21/12990778/thorne-rooms-art-institute-chicago-miniature|title=Meticulous and miniature: The Thorne Rooms of the Art Institute|last=LaFree|first=Jessie|date=September 21, 2016|work=[[Curbed|Curbed Chicago]]|access-date=September 23, 2018}}</ref> The Art Institute of Chicago's rooms are among the museum's most popular permanent collections.<ref name="LaFree" />
The [[Knoxville Museum of Art]] is home to 9 of the remaining rooms, while [[The Children's Museum of Indianapolis]] and the [[Kaye Miniature Museum]] in [[Los Angeles]] have one each.<ref name="PAM" />
Some of the Thorne rooms are miniature replicas of actual rooms.<ref name="PAM" /> They were constructed on a [[1:12 scale]],<ref name="PAM" /> or in other words a scale of {{Convert|1|in|cm}} to {{Convert|1|ft|m}}.<ref name="AIC" /> The rooms are largely made of the same materials as full-sized rooms; for example, they include bowls made of silver, chandeliers made of crystal, and even original works of art, both miniature paintings (by [[Fernand Léger]], [[Hildreth Meiere|Hildreth Meière]], [[Amédée Ozenfant]], and [[Léopold Survage]]) and sculptures (by [[John Storrs]]).<ref name="LaFree" />
In 2010, the Art Institute of Chicago began decorating a few of its rooms for [[Christmas]], [[Hanukkah]], and [[New Year|New Year's]], using period-appropriate decorations for each of the involved rooms.<ref name="Kogan" /><ref name="Zivanovic">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nwitimes.com/lifestyles/small-worlds-promise-big-delights/article_419e3142-602a-56b6-bc43-90a3ae874f00.html|title=Small worlds promise big delights|last=Zivanovic|first=Crista|date=December 10, 2016|work=[[The Times of Northwest Indiana]]|access-date=September 23, 2018}}</ref> Lindsey Mican Morgan, who is responsible for the rooms at the Art Institute, began the practice of decorating the rooms for the holidays after discovering Thorne's great affection for Christmas while researching.<ref name="Kogan" />
==See also== *[[Colleen Moore#Colleen Moore Fairy Castle (Dollhouse)|Colleen Moore Fairy Castle]]
== References == {{Reflist|30em}}

revision.text:
{{For|the 1936 British film|Ticket of Leave (film)}} {{globalize/UK|date=October 2015}} A '''ticket of leave''' was a document of [[parole]] issued to [[convict]]s who had shown they could now be trusted with some freedoms. Originally the ticket was issued in [[United Kingdom|Britain]] and later adapted by the [[United States]], [[Canada]], and [[Ireland]].
==Jurisdictions== ===Australia=== The ticket of leave system was first introduced by [[Governor_of_New_South_Wales#History|Governor]] [[Philip Gidley King]] in 1801. Its principal aim was to reduce the burden on the fledgling [[colony|colonial]] government of providing food from the government's limited stores to the [[convicts in Australia|convicts]] who were being [[penal transportation|transported]] from the [[United Kingdom]] to [[New South Wales]]. Convicts who seemed able to support themselves were awarded a ticket of leave. Before too long, tickets began to be given as a reward for good behaviour, which permitted the holders to seek [[employment]] within a specified district, but not leave it without the permission of the government or the district's [[resident magistrate]]. Each change of employer or district was recorded on the ticket.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://scholar.google.com/scholar?hl=en&lr=&q=info:nSoxUNfT2J0J:scholar.google.com/&output=viewport|title=Bottomley: Parole in Transition: A Comparative Study of Origins, Developments, and Prospects for the 1990s|publisher=scholar.google.com|accessdate=2008-05-11}}</ref>
Originally the ticket of leave was given without any relation to the period of the sentence a convict had already served. Some "[[gentleman|gentlemen]] convicts" were issued with tickets on their arrival in the colony. Starting in 1811, the need to first officiate some time in [[penal labour|servitude]] was established, and in 1821 [[Thomas Brisbane|Governor Brisbane]] introduced regulations specifying the lengths of sentences that had to be served before a convict could be considered for a ticket: four years for a seven-year sentence, six to eight years for a 14-year sentence, and 10 to 12 years for those with a life sentence. Once the full original sentence had been served, a "certificate of freedom" would be issued upon application.<ref>{{cite web|title=Convicts and the British colonies in Australia|url=http://www.australia.gov.au/about-australia/australian-story/convicts-and-the-british-colonies|website=australia.gov.au|publisher=Australian Government|accessdate=2017-01-03|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160101181100/http://www.australia.gov.au/about-australia/australian-story/convicts-and-the-british-colonies|archivedate=1 January 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name=TTCO>{{cite book|title=Treating the criminal offender|year=1988|publisher=Springer|isbn=978-0-306-42885-2|url=https://books.google.com/?id=SiXXzCkFAgwC&pg=PA25&dq=ticket+of+leave#v=onepage&q=ticket%20of%20leave&f=false|author=Alexander B. Smith|author2=Louis Berlin |accessdate=7 February 2011|page=25}}</ref>
Ticket-of-leave holders were permitted to [[marry]], or to bring their families from Britain, and to acquire property, but they were not permitted to carry [[firearm]]s or board a [[ship]]. Convicts who observed the conditions of the ticket of leave until the completion of one half of their sentence were entitled to a conditional [[pardon]], which removed all restrictions except a ban on leaving the colony. Convicts who did not observe the conditions of their ticket could be [[arrest]]ed without [[warrant (legal)|warrant]], tried without recourse to the [[Supreme Court of New South Wales|Supreme Court]], and would forfeit their property. The ticket of leave had to be renewed annually, and those with one had to attend muster and church services.
[[File:Ticket of Leave Passport.jpg|thumb|NSW Colonial Government - 1846 Convict Ticket of Leave Passport]]
The ticket itself was a highly detailed document, listing the place and year the convict was tried, the name of the ship in which he or she was transported, and the length of the sentence. There was also a complete physical description of the convict, along with year of birth, former occupation and "native place".
A ticket had two components: The "ticket proper" was issued to the person named, and it was mandatory for the person to carry that document on their person at all times. The second component was the "butt", which was the official copy and was kept on file by the Government. Tickets proper are now quite rare as they were in constant use by the holder. The butts are still retained in archival records and are available for researchers.
According to [[Alexander Maconochie (penal reformer)|Alexander Maconochie]], tickets of leave could be suspended in summary fashion for the most "trifling irregularities," and a "very large proportion" of ticket-of-leave holders were returned to government work as a result.<ref>{{cite journal|author=Doherty, Fiona|title=Indeterminate Sentencing Returns: The Invention of Supervised Release|volume=88|journal=N.Y.U. L. Rev.|number=958|date=2013}}</ref>
===British military=== In the [[Second World War]], the "ticket of leave" was a colloquial name given to the papers allowing a soldier to take leave from active service.<ref name=JVIFWW>{{cite book|last=Smith|first=Richard|title=Jamaican volunteers in the First World War : race, masculinity and the development of national consciousness|year=2004|publisher=Manchester Univ. Press|isbn=978-0-7190-6985-7|url=https://books.google.com/?id=B_4gZ_SeW2cC&pg=PA84&dq=ticket+of+leave+world+war+ii#v=snippet&q=ticket-of-leave&f=false|edition=1. publ.}}</ref> <!-- Add American, U.S. and Canada -->
===Canada=== On August 11, 1899, An Act to Provide for the Conditional Liberation of Convicts - the Ticket of Leave Act - was enacted by the Canadian Parliament.
The Canadian Ticket of Leave Act was based almost word for word on the British legislation. There was no reference in the text to the purpose of conditional release, though ticket of leave was generally understood to be a form of pardon.
In the beginning, the Governor General granted paroles on the advice of Cabinet as a whole. The act was later amended so that the power to advise the Governor General was limited to the Minister of Justice. This was a significant departure from traditional practice in the use of executive clemency; it was an attempt to separate parole decisions from politics. Even so, because conditional release was still in the hands of an elected minister, public opinion would still have a strong, and sometimes questionable, influence on policy.
In the early 20th century, Canada was sparsely settled. Keeping track of men on tickets of leave was difficult and the authorities relied on parolees to report every month to the police. This had its drawbacks, and when the Salvation Army offered to take over parole supervision in some places, the Department of Justice was glad to accept. Salvation Army officers acted as Dominion Parole Officers until the position was abolished in 1931.
On March 7, 1939, Bill C-34 was passed, revising the Penitentiary Act and creating an administrative board of three.
===Ireland=== [[Walter Crofton]] administered the Irish ticket of leave system.
==See also== * [[Certificate of Freedom]] * [[The Ticket-of-Leave Man (disambiguation)|The Ticket-of-Leave Man]]

revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{refimprove|date=August 2009}} {{original research|date=August 2009}} {{no footnotes|date=July 2010}} }}
A '''zero-marking language''' is one with no [[marker (linguistics)|grammatical marks]] on the dependents or the [[grammatical modifier|modifiers]] or the [[head (linguistics)|heads]] or [[nucleus (linguistics)|nuclei]] that show the relationship between different constituents of a phrase.
Pervasive zero marking is very rare, but instances of zero marking in various forms occur in quite a number of [[language]]s. [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]] and [[Indonesian language|Indonesian]] are two national languages listed in the [[World Atlas of Language Structures]] as having zero-marking. [[Pirahã language|Pirahã]] is another language having zero-marking among its other very rare features.
In many [[East and Southeast Asian languages]], such as [[Thai language|Thai]] and [[Chinese language|Chinese]], the head [[verb]] and its dependents are not marked for any arguments or for the [[noun]]s' roles in the sentence. On the other hand, possession is marked in such languages by the use of clitic particles between possessor and possessed.
Some languages, such as [[Arabic]], use a similar process, called juxtaposition, to indicate possessive relationships. In Arabic, two nouns next to each other could indicate a possessed-possessor construction: {{lang|ar|كتب مريم}} ''{{transl|ar|kutub Maryam}}'' "Maryam's books" (literally "books Maryam"). The rarity of pervasive zero marking is due to languages with juxtaposition having more of [[inflection]] than languages with zero marking in noun phrases so the two almost never overlap.
Zero-marking, when it occurs, tends to show a strong relationship with word order. Languages in which zero-marking is widespread are almost all [[subject–verb–object]], perhaps because verb-medial order allows two or more [[noun]]s to be recognised as such much more easily than [[subject–object–verb]], [[object–subject–verb]], [[verb–subject–object]], or [[verb-object-subject]] order, for which two nouns might be adjacent and their role in a sentence possibly thus confused.{{citation needed|date=April 2013}} It has been suggested that verb-final languages may be likely to develop verb-medial order if marking on nouns is lost.{{Citation needed|date=April 2009}}
== See also == * [[Analytic language]] * [[Dependent-marking language]] * [[Double-marking language]] * [[Head-marking language]] * [[Zero-marking in English]]
==References== * Maddieson, Ian. "Locus of Marking: Whole-Language Typology", in Martin Haspelmath et al. (eds.) ''The World Atlas of Language Structures'', pp. 106–109. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2005. {{ISBN|0-19-925591-1}}.
== External links == * [http://wals.info/feature/25 WALS Feature/Chapter 25: Locus of Marking: Whole-language Typology]
[[Category:Linguistic typology]] [[Category:Zero (linguistics)]]

{{short description|Dutch television series}} {{Infobox television | show_name = Zondag met Lubach | image = Zondag met Lubach.jpg | genre = [[Satire]] | creator = | director = Jan Gitsels
Henk van Engen | presenter = [[Arjen Lubach]] | starring = Tex de Wit
Steye van Dam | country = [[Netherlands]] | language = [[Dutch language|Dutch]] | num_seasons = 9 | num_episodes = 73 (per September 21 2018) | producer = Irene van den Brekel | runtime = 30 minutes | company = Human Factor TV | distributor = [[VPRO]] | network = [[NPO 3]] | website = http://www.vpro.nl/zondag-met-lubach | voice-over = | music = }} '''''{{Lang|nl|Zondag met Lubach}}''''' ({{Language with name/for|2=Dutch|3=Sunday with Lubach}}) is a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] weekly satirical television programme presented by [[Arjen Lubach]] and broadcast on [[NPO 3]].{{cite news|title=Zondag met Lubach ontdekt drugsproblemen in Brabant én geeft tips om ze op te lossen|url=http://www.omroepbrabant.nl/?news/2697381323/Zondag+met+Lubach+ontdekt+drugsproblemen+in+Brabant+én+geeft+tips+om+ze+op+te+lossen.aspx|accessdate=11 October 2017|work=Omroep Brabant|date=24 September 2017|language=Dutch}}{{cite news|title=Satirisch NRA-filmpje van Zondag met Lubach is YouTube-hit |url=https://www.nu.nl/media/4956992/satirisch-nra-filmpje-van-zondag-met-lubach-youtube-hit.html |accessdate=11 October 2017|work=NU.nl|publisher=Sanoma Media|date=9 October 2017 |language=Dutch}} Each week Lubach talks for half an hour about the news of the past week through various fragments from the media infographics and investigative journalism. The show's main scriptwriters are Tex de Wit and Pieter Jouke. The program is recorded in the big room of the Theater Bellevue in [[Amsterdam]]. ==Notable stunts== ===Pharaoh of the Netherlands (2015)=== Arjen Lubach is a strong opponent of the [[monarchy of the Netherlands]].{{Cite news |url=https://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2013/04/29/tien-argumenten-voor-de-monarchie-ontkracht-alcohol-en-dag-vrij-beter-dan-zwaaiende-koning-in-touringcar-a1492509 |title=Tien argumenten vóór de monarchie ontkracht door Arjen Lubach |author=Arjen Lubach |work=[[NRC Handelsblad]] |date=29 April 2013 |accessdate=12 October 2017|language=nl}} Out of protest against the monarchy, he came up with a citizens initiative, in which he crowned himself "[[Pharaoh]] of the Netherlands", which, like 'King' is also a hereditary title. At the time of the airing of the show in which he introduced his initiative, it was 200 years since [[William I of the Netherlands|William I]] proclaimed himself a King of the Netherlands. For the citizens initiative Lubach needed a minimum of 40.000 endorsements, which he obtained while he was a guest at the Dutch talk show ''[[De Wereld Draait Door]]''. With the minimum of 40.000 endorsements, the [[House of Representatives (Netherlands)|House of Representatives]] was obliged to talk about the initiative.{{Cite news |url=https://nos.nl/op3/artikel/2026504-50-000-tekenaars-voor-farao-initiatief-arjen-lubach.html |title=50.000 tekenaars voor farao-initiatief Arjen Lubach |publisher=[[Nederlandse Omroep Stichting|NOS]] |date=23 March 2015 |accessdate=12 October 2017|language=nl}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EIOHmOOQA9k |title=De monarchie - Zondag met Lubach (S02) |work=Zondag met Lubach |date=22 March 2015 |accessdate=12 October 2017|language=nl}} ===Donald Trump video (2017)=== {{See also|Every Second Counts (video contest)}} ''Zondag met Lubach'' inspired the global [[Every Second Counts (video contest)|video contest Every Second Counts]] after it broadcast the parody video "The Netherlands welcomes Trump in his own words" on 22 January 2017.{{Cite news |url=http://www.volkskrant.nl/buitenland/in-navolging-van-lubach-strijdt-heel-europa-om-second-te-worden~a4457614/ |title=In navolging van Lubach strijdt heel Europa om 'second' te worden |author=Gijs Beukers |work=[[de Volkskrant]] |date=3 February 2017 |accessdate=7 February 2017 |language=nl}} In the video, [[Donald Trump]]'s speeches and actions –mostly from [[Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2016|his election campaign]]– are imitated and mocked by voice actor [[Greg Shapiro]],{{Cite news |url=http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2017/02/donald-trump-trolling-videos-america-first-netherlands-second-greg-shapiro-shaun-streeter |title=Meet the Men Trolling Trump in Those Viral European Videos |author=Hillary Busis |work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]] |date=7 February 2017 |accessdate=7 February 2017}} who gives a short description of the Netherlands using some [[self-mockery]] as well, finishing with the request that the Netherlands may come 'second' if America is to be 'first'. A semi-serious undertone is formed by fears that Trump's announced [[America First (policy)|"America First" policy]] signifies [[isolationism]], including withdrawing U.S. support for [[NATO]]:{{Cite news |url=https://www.theatlantic.com/news/archive/2016/07/trump-nato/492341/ |title=Donald Trump's NATO Remarks Stuns U.S. Allies |author=Krishnadev Calamur |work=[[The Atlantic]] |date=21 July 2016 |accessdate=8 February 2017}} "If you screw NATO, you're gonna make our problems [[Make America Great Again|great again]]."{{Cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2017/01/25/dutch-tv-trolls-donald-trump-hard-in-this-new-welcome-video/ |title=Dutch TV trolls Donald Trump hard in this new ‘welcome’ video |author=Amanda Erickson |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=25 January 2017 |accessdate=8 February 2017}} The video went viral, being discussed by multiple international newsmedia{{Cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/01/24/dutch-tv-trolls-donald-trumps-america-first-speech-welcome-video/ |title=Dutch TV trolls Donald Trump's 'America First' speech in 'welcome' video |author=Mark Molloy |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=24 January 2017 |accessdate=7 February 2017}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2017/01/26/world/europe/ap-eu-netherlands-viral-video.html |title=Video Introducing Trump to the Netherlands Goes Viral |author=AP |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=26 January 2017 |accessdate=7 February 2017}} and reaching over 73 million views worldwide by 3 February. On 2 February during ''[[Neo Magazin Royale]]'', [[Jan Böhmermann]] challenged the Dutch's second place, broadcasting a rival video that claimed 'Germany second' whilst making fun of the Netherlands and Germany itself as well. Then, he encouraged other satirical talkshow producers in all European countries to make similar videos parodying Trump, themselves and challenging the Netherlands' second place behind America.{{Cite news |url=http://nos.nl/artikel/2156281-varianten-op-lubachs-introductievideo-blijven-binnenkomen.html |title=Varianten op Lubachs introductievideo blijven binnenkomen |publisher=[[Nederlandse Omroep Stichting|NOS]] |date=3 February 2017 |accessdate=7 February 2017 |language=nl}} Production teams in at least eleven other countries committed to making their own parody videos, and by 3 February, versions for [[Belgium]] (by ''De Ideale Wereld''), [[Switzerland]] (by ''Deville Late Night''), [[Denmark]] (by ''Natholdet''), [[Portugal]] (by ''[[5 Para A Meia-Noite]]'') and [[Lithuania]] (by ''Laikykitės ten'') had been released; these would all be gathered on the website everysecondcounts.eu. ===Westeros the Series (2017)=== In late August 2017, a YouTube channel named "Westeros The Series" uploaded a "trailer" for ''Westeros'', a new 'television series' that would be set in a modern-day [[Westeros]] after the events of ''[[Game of Thrones]]'', and would premiere in 2019.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H9U-rhVp1CQ|title=TRAILER WESTEROS THE SERIES - GAME OF THRONES SPINOFF|first=|last=Westeros The Series|date=29 August 2017|publisher=|via=YouTube}}{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/tv/2017/08/31/modern-day-game-thrones-everybody-hooked-mysterious-trailer/|title=Modern-day Game of Thrones: Everybody is hooked on this mysterious trailer for Westeros 2019|first=Telegraph|last=Reporters|date=31 August 2017|publisher=|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}}{{cite web|url=https://www.vice.com/en_ca/article/5994y8/this-game-of-thrones-trailer-set-in-modern-day-is-incredible|title=This 'Game of Thrones' Trailer Set in Modern Day Is Incredible|date=30 August 2017|publisher=}} After getting attention from media, including ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' and ''[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]]'', the channel uploaded another video on YouTube in early September 2017, instead revealing that ''Zondag met Lubach'' would return on 10 September 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JPVIJlKfAOs|title=WESTEROS THE SERIES - THE REVEAL|first=|last=Westeros The Series|date=4 September 2017|publisher=|via=YouTube}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dutchnews.nl/news/archives/2017/09/westeros-2019-game-of-thrones-clip-is-a-dutch-tv-show-trailer/|title=Westeros 2019: Game of Thrones clip is a Dutch tv show trailer - DutchNews.nl|date=4 September 2017|publisher=}} ''Zondag met Lubach''{{'}}s official YouTube channel also uploaded a combined version of the 'trailer'.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=088u4wK7uEY|title=Westeros the Series - The Reveal|first=|last=vpro zondag met lubach|date=4 September 2017|publisher=|via=YouTube}} ===Nonsensical Rifle Addiction (2017)=== On 8 October 2017, one week after the [[2017 Las Vegas shooting]], ''Zondag met Lubach'' aired a spoof advertisement called "Nonsensical Rifle Addiction", which highlighted the issue with [[Gun violence in the United States|gun violence]] and [[mass shootings in the United States]], and also lampooned the United States's [[Gun politics in the United States|inability to introduce any binding form of gun control]]. The title is a play on the influential American gun rights organisation [[National Rifle Association]] (NRA). The video was retweeted by American actor [[Samuel L. Jackson]] after the [[Stoneman Douglas High School shooting]] in February 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.bandt.com.au/campaigns/spoof-ad-lampoons|title=Spoof Ad Lampoons America’s ‘Nonsensical Rifle Addiction’ - B&T|date=11 October 2017|publisher=}}[https://www.bustle.com/p/this-dutch-video-about-americas-nonsensical-rifle-addiction-hits-the-nail-on-the-head-2842255 This Dutch video about America's nonsensical rifle addiction hits the nail on the head], bustle.com. ==Awards== ===Zilveren Nipkowschijf (2016)=== [[File:Zondag met Lubach effen.jpg|thumb|The show's social media profile icon]] [[File:Theater Bellevue, Leidsekade foto 1.jpg|thumb|Theater Bellevue in Amsterdam, where the show takes place]] On 10 June 2016 ''Zondag met Lubach'' won the [[Zilveren Nipkowschijf]].{{Cite news |url=https://www.nrc.nl//nieuws/2016/06/10/zondag-met-lubach-wint-zilveren-nipkowschijf-a1406634 |title=Zondag met Lubach wint Zilveren Nipkowschijf |author=Bastiaan Nagtegaal |work=[[NRC Handelsblad]] |date=10 June 2016 |accessdate=19 October 2017|language=nl}} The winner of the price is chosen by a jury consisting out of newspapers and magazines television critici. The year before, Zondag met Lubach received an honorable mention by the jury {{Cite news |url=https://www.parool.nl/kunst-en-media/zondag-met-lubach-wint-zilveren-nipkowschijf~a4317785/ |title=Zondag met Lubach wint Zilveren Nipkowschijf |author=Joep School |work=[[Parool]] |date=10 June 2016 |accessdate=19 October 2017|language=nl}} ===Gouden Televizier-Ring (2017)=== ====Best Television show==== On 11 October 2017 during the Televizier-Ring Gala, ''Zondag met Lubach'' was awarded the Gouden Televizier-Ring (Golden television ring) for "Best television program".{{Cite news |url=https://nos.nl/artikel/2197703-gouden-televizier-ring-voor-zondag-met-lubach.html |title=Gouden Televizier-Ring voor Zondag met Lubach |work=[[Nederlandse Omroep Stichting|Nos]] |date=12 October 2017 |accessdate=23 October 2017|language=nl}} Zondag met Lubach got a plurality of the vote with 47%. During the airing of the award-show people could vote on one of the three nominees for "Best television program". The two other nominees for the price were, [[Beste Zangers]] and [[Expeditie Robinson]]. Arjen Lubach started off his reception speech with saying "Wat ontzettend terecht" meaning "How very much deserved" (meant as a joke). Furthermore, he praised the rest of his team and expressed their importance. This was the first time that a vpro-program won the prize.{{Cite news |url=https://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2017/10/12/lubach-uitgeroepen-tot-populairste-tv-programma-13466235-a1577125 |title=Arjen Lubach wint Gouden Televizier-Ring |work=[[Nrc]] |date=12 October 2017 |accessdate=23 October 2017|language=nl}} To get people to vote on Zml during the award-show, Arjen Lubach had an advert placed on the [[Ziggo Dome]]. In this advert the presenter of ''Beste zangers'' and presenters of ''Expeditie Robinson'' were seen giving the advice to vote on Zondag met Lubach and later thanked by Lubach. This initially angered a few people, because they thought that the advert was paid with tax money. However, Lubach later said that this was not the case and that he knew a few people who could get this done.{{Cite news |url=https://www.televizier.nl/categorie/televizier-ring/dit-was-de-ziggo-dome-stunt-van-arjen-lubach.4035197.lynkx |title=Dit was de Ziggo Dome-stunt van Arjen Lubach |work=[[televizier]] |date=13 October 2017 |accessdate=23 October 2017|language=nl}} ====Best actor==== To gain the attention of his viewers about the nomination for best actor, Lubach talked about it on his show, however he didn't talk about his own nomination. Instead, he talked about Erik de Vogel, who got nominated in the category for best actor. He requested people to vote for De Vogel, together with a catchphrase "Ludo verdient een kudo" meaning Ludo (name of the actor's role in [[Goede tijden, slechte tijden]]) deserves kudos.{{Cite news |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Xa629dwYuA |title=Ludo verdient een kudo - Zondag met Lubach (S07) |work=[[Youtube]] |date=24 September 2017 |accessdate=23 October 2017|language=nl}} De Vogel did however not win the award, as it was given to [[Jeroen van Koningsbrugge]] instead.{{Cite news |url=https://www.televizier.nl/categorie/televizier-ring/zilveren-televizier-ster-acteur-voor-jeroen-van.4035074.lynkx |title=Zilveren Televizier-Ster Acteur voor Jeroen van Koningsbrugge |work=[[televizier]] |date=12 October 2017 |accessdate=23 October 2017|language=nl}} ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Dutch television talk shows]] [[Category:Dutch television news programs]] [[Category:Dutch comedy television series]] [[Category:Dutch television sketch shows]] [[Category:Self-reflexive television]] [[Category:News parodies]] [[Category:2014 Dutch television series debuts]] [[Category:Dutch satirical television programmes]] [[Category:2010s Dutch television series]]
